    Ravi Raju

    Chief Research Scientist
    E-307, Department of Materials Engineering
    Indian Institute of Science, C V Raman Avenue
    Bangalore-560012, INDIA

    office: Room E 307
    e-mail: rravi_at_iisc.ac.in
    phone: +91 80 2293 3244
    web: https://materials.iisc.ac.in/faculty/rravi

    Research Interests

    Exploratory analysis of Metallurgical data using Machine learning

    • Artificial Neural Network(ANN) Models to Predict workability parameters for Dynamic recrystallisation domain and Instability regimes.
    • ANN Models for predicting Instability Regimes: Cu-Al, Cu-Zn Alloys.

    Diffusion related studies

    • Systems with high temperature applications: Ni, Fe-Ni base super alloys and Co-base super alloys:Co-W, Co-Ta and Co-Ni-Ta; Nb-X (X-Ni,Co,Fe).
    • Automobile applications: Hot dip Aluminum coating on steel.
    • Electronic packaging materials: Pd-Sn; Au(Cu)-Sn; Cu(Ni)-Sn.

    Tin whiskering

    • Effect of electric current and substrate composition on whiskering in Tin and on IMC growth.

    M.E Students

    • Arkoprabho Roy (with Prof. Praveen Kumar)
      Effect of chrominum addition on whiskering in tin (2023).
    • Dineshkumar M (with Prof. Aloke Paul)
      Diffusion controlled growth of product phases between steel and aluminium alloys (2023).
    • Satyam Kumar (with Prof. Aloke Paul)
      Diffusion analysis in Ni-X (X = Cr, Ta, Mo, W, Re) systems (2021).
    • Hemanta Kumar Meher (with Prof. Praveen Kumar)
      Effect of substrate composition on whiskering (2020).
    • Abhilash Agnihotri (with Prof. Praveen Kumar)
      Effect of electric current on whiskering in Tin (2019).
    • Mangesh Pantawane (with Prof. Aloke Paul)
      Study on effect of chromium addition on tungsten-Free cobalt based superalloy (2017).
    • Sarfaraj Islam (with Prof. Aloke Paul)
      The phase evolution in Au(Cu)/Sn system by solid state reactive diffusion and diffusion studies in Cu(Ni)/Sn (2013).
    • Varun A Baheti (with Prof. Aloke Paul)
      Interdiffusion studies in binary Co-Ta system and ternary Co(Ni)-Ta, Co(Ni)-Nb and Fe(Ni)-Nb systems (2012).

    2. K. Monisha, S.M. Shariff, A. Sekar, Ravi Raju, J. Manonmani and Senthilselvan Jayaraman; Titanium boride coating by high power laser alloying of amorphous boron with titanium and its surface property investigations, Optics and Laser Technology 170 (2024) 110159.
    3. Prafull Pandey, Mangesh V. Pantawane, Nithin Baler, Raju Ravi, Surendra Kumar Makineni, Kamanio Chattopadhyay, Effect of Cr addition on the Gamma' strengthened CoNiCrAlMo compositionally complex alloy, Journal of Materials Science and Technology 39:3 (2023) 347-361. https://doi.org/10.1080/02670836.2022.2114615.

Krishnamurthy, Climate change scenarios, their impacts and implications on Indian cardamom-coffee hot spots; one of the two in the world, journal Frontiers in Sustainable Food Systems, December 2022, DOI 10.3389/fsufs.2022.1057617.

Manonmani and Senthilselvan Jayaraman; Titanium boride and titanium silicide phase formation by high power diode laser alloying of B4C and SiC particles with Ti: Microstructure, hardness and wear studies, Materials Today Communications https://doi.org/10.1016/j.mtcomm.2022.103741.

R.Ravi, Y.V.R.K.Prasad and V.V.S.Sarma, “Artificial Neural Network Models to Predict workability parameters for Dynamic recrystallisation domain and Instability regimes”, International Workshop on Neural Network and Genetic Algorithm in Material Science and Engineering (NGMS-2006), January 11-13, 2006, Bengal Engineering and Science University, Shibpur, Howrah, India, Tata McGraw Hill, pp.257-271.

    Coverage in News Media

    • Climate change likely to affect cardamom-coffee hotspots of South India
      Study published in the journal Frontiers in Sustainable Food Systems says cardamom is more climate sensitive compared to coffee. A 40% dip in annual rainfall hardly affected the yields of coffee during 2017–2018 while the cardamom yield was reduced to nearly 50%.
